title: Replace homepage CONTROL framework images with colourful, text-free visuals

requirements.text: Replace the seven homepage CONTROL™ framework step images used in `frontend/src/components/sections/ControlFrameworkSection.tsx` with higher-quality, more colourful images that contain no text and are visually relevant to each step (Clarify, Organize, Normalize, Transform, Report, Optimize, Lead).

quotes: The images used in the control framework on the homepage look really bad. Can you update them with more colourful images and not have any text on the images. But still be relevant to the content

acceptanceCriteria: Each CONTROL™ step card on the homepage displays a new, more colourful image.
None of the seven images contain embedded text.

Each image is visually relevant to its step (e.g., clarity/diagnostic, organization/structure, normalization/standards, transformation/automation, reporting/dashboards, optimization/continuous improvement, leadership/governance).
Images load correctly from the static assets path and do not produce 404s in the browser console.

requirements.text: Update the image asset references in `frontend/src/components/sections/ControlFrameworkSection.tsx` to point to the new/replaced image filenames under `/assets/generated/` (keeping the existing layout, aspect ratio, and hover behavior intact).

quotes: update them with more colourful images and not have any text on the images

acceptanceCriteria: `frameworkSteps` in `ControlFrameworkSection.tsx` references the new image filenames for all seven steps.
The CONTROL™ framework section layout remains unchanged aside from the updated images (same card grid/scroll behavior, same letter badge overlay, same aspect ratio).

constraints: Do not edit files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (compose them only).
Do not change unrelated homepage sections or backend behavior; scope is limited to the CONTROL™ framework images on the homepage.
nonGoals: Redesigning the CONTROL™ framework section layout, typography, or copy.
Changing the CONTROL™ framework content on `/control-framework` page.
Adding new backend endpoints or modifying lead/admin functionality.
